docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 10. -- The deadlock which had been holding up the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace for a week was solved today by an agreement among the leaders and the conference finally got under way.

docs.lead_paragraph: Continued strength in South American dollar obligations and a cautious attitude in the market for United States Government loans, pending official announcement of allotments on the new Treasury 2 1/2s, characterized bond trading yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10. -- The United States threw its moral support today behind the new Franco-British proposal to Germany, Italy, Russia and Portugal for mediation in Spain to terminate the civil war, but declined to join in the movement because of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10. -- The United States threw its moral support today behind the new Franco-British proposal to Germany, Italy, Russia and Portugal for mediation in Spain to terminate the civil war, but declined to join in the movement because of its policy of non-interference in the affairs of other countries.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 12. -- A small group of strongly pro-American members of the House of Commons is going to have a private, informal dinner on Tuesday to form a committee for the study of Anglo-American relations with a view to furthering every effort to...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 12. -- A small group of strongly pro-American members of the House of Commons is going to have a private, informal dinner on Tuesday to form a committee for the study of Anglo-American relations with a view to furthering every effort to improve them.

docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 14. -- The Argentine delegation today again upset the equilibrium of the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace by withdrawing the approval it was understood previously to have given to the neutrality convention coordinating existing peace machinery of the Americas.

byline.original: By HAROLD B. HINTONSpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 14. -- The Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace took a strong stand today in favor of a moral disarmament as one of the most important conditions for preserving peace. The conference gave its support to several...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 14. -- The Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace took a strong stand today in favor of a moral disarmament as one of the most important conditions for preserving peace. The conference gave its support to several intellectual and cultural matters that it considered to be measures tending toward moral disarmament by creating an atmosphere of good-will and understanding among the American nations.
